Cross Miami's Coley off Kentucky's list for OC

Miami offensive coordinator James Coley not a candidate for Kentucky football's opening

Cross Miami's Coley off Kentucky's list for OC

Kyle Tucker, ktucker@courier-journal.com 10:34 a.m. EST December 2, 2014

MIAMI - 2006: James Coley of the Miami Dolphins poses for his 2006 NFL headshot at photo day in Miami, Florida. (Photo by Getty Images) (Photo: Getty Images, Getty Images)

1 CONNECT 26 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

Cross one name off the list of potential candidates for the University of Kentucky football program's offensive coordinator opening. Wildcats coach Mark Stoops has "no intention" of talking to Miami Hurricanes coordinator James Coley, as it is "not the right fit at UK," according to a source.

Coley's name popped up Monday and there was at least one report on Twitter that he was taking the job, but that would've represented a major shift in philosophy for Stoops. While Coley is considered one of the nation's top recruiters and worked with Stoops for three years at Florida State, he runs a pro-style offense.

Former Cats coordinator Neal Brown ran an "Air Raid" offense – a shotgun-spread attack that is, ideally, pass-heavy – and Kentucky has recruited specifically to that system for three classes now. Miami ran the ball 100 times more than it passed in two seasons with Coley running its offense.

RELATED: Reviewing Mark Stoops' second year as Cats' coach.

While Stoops has expressed a desire to run the ball better and be more physical at times on offense, the Wildcats are just now getting fully stocked with the talent needed to make the Air Raid fly. Changing styles would likely come with a whole new set of growing pains. UK has just one scholarship tight end currently on the roster, for instance.

Assuming Stoops sticks with a similar style, names to watch are East Carolina coordinator Lincoln Riley, Cincinnati coordinator Eddie Gran and Murray State head coach Chris Hatcher. Gran also worked with Stoops previously at Florida State. But according to a source, Stoops is fully in recruiting mode – on the road trying to secure a third consecutive top-30 class – and is still only in the information-gathering stage on candidates.

* For instant updates on the Wildcats, follow me on Twitter @KyleTucker_CJ. Email me at ktucker@courier-journal.com.
